revised_title: An Inquiry into the Origin of Mankind and Field Medicine
tldr: The author examines various philosophical hypotheses about the origin of mankind and the existence of spontaneous generation. They also discuss field medicine, including treatments for diseases like plague, scurvy, and venereal pox. The text also contains various remedies and observations about Chinese medicine and distillery.
scientific_discipline: Social Sciences, Art, and Humanities > Philosophy of Nature
